comments.body: Estoy de acuerdo

This is cool, but I feel like it'd make more sense for it to be an armour enchantment rather than a tool enchantment, although I also feel like it's more balanced for it to be a tool enchantment. It's just mainly the name that makes it feel like an armour enchantment

I just feel it's kinda unnecesary, specially sticks since this would mean we'd have like 12 variants for EVERY TOOL AND WEAPON IN THE GAME which is just absurd, and even if this isn't the case it's still just too many recolors. Maybe for bookshelves, lecterns, ladders, armor stands and a few more, but every work station, beds, fishing rods and more is just too much
Redstone...?

yeah, but gunpowder has a time limit to go off, so let's say you wanted to blow up your friends house, the explosion would be delayed, so you'd have time to get back to your base, with no evidence leading back to you, unless it's just you and one friend

Gold is only bad because of its durability and cost in xp. It would be cool to see some decorative uses for gold and iron tho. Maybe combining gold with copper to make a decorative version of gold or combining copper decorative blocks with gold since in real life gold is too soft so people usually used something similar or just combined copper and gold to make something that looks like gold but is stronger. Diamond and Netherite I think it's too much and not a good idea.

trying to be helpful
I know a block you can use
gilded blackstone
Each weapon type os supposed to be unique
Tridents

Too unnecesary and kinda unrealistic. Silver and Zinc seem unnecesary (and so does Electrum and Brass) and Bronze should actually be better than Iron but worse than Steel. Also if Steel is so easy to make, why would you even use Bronze or even Iron in the first place instead of just making Steel with it? Steel needs to be hard to make or have a low chance to get instead of Iron when smelting Raw Iron or something to balance it. Also what would the point of Rose Gold be besides doing the same as Gold with Piglins and decorative blocks? I mean, it kinda is a good idea but has way more potential than just that.

Since the point of it using a breeze rod is probably related to negate fall damage and the wind burst enchantment, a blaze mace would probably not negate fall damage but could ignite in an area and maybe have another enchantment to replace wind burst

Breeze Rod -> Allows for windburst
Blaze Rod -> Allows for Fire Aspect & Knockback
Bamboo -> Allows for Looting (Durability Cost?)

We don't need a whole bunch of new enchants, they don't even need to be better than wind burst just allowing the option would be neat- with looting you could enable some fun stuff with the mace for sure.
drip or drown
And maybe even Gold Lanterns would be a good idea.
also, maybe certain hostile mobs won't be able to cross salt lines

I have two further or at least compatible ideas:
1. A salt pillar block, to compliment quartz and quartz pillars.
2. If it is ever decided that the Savanna (unsure of spelling ) biome is indeed updated, like Mojang said might happen; the other comment about mob salt lines would compliment the possibility of adding termites.
Yes please! I need both of those in my world!!!!
To add to that I belive Nether Fortresses generated in the Basalt Delta should be made of Blackstone instead of Nether Brick

BlackNinjaHer0 Nether Brick is not wood either...

or is it?!
This is a great idea as this would have many uses for example as Gutters on the sides of Victorian houses or as Portcullises on Castle Gates!
386181465371 I mean neither is Nether Brick and it has fences so... why not?

Nether brick only had fences because they were a thing before walls were, and they opted to not remove them I guess. I think they should remove them actually if anything rather that adding more stone fence variants.... wood fence, stone wall. Makes sense to me lol

Maybe walls instead of fences, as most stones have walls. With the exception of nether brick as it has both I belive, but I think a blackstone wall whould look nicer then a blackstone fence. And I whould add a normal and polished blackstone varient, maybe a brick wall varient if stone bricks have walls too, I forgot if they did or not
And the textures will be changed into the wood the tool made out of
And the textures will be changed into the wood the tool made out of
Interesting... what kind of mobs would it prevent from attracting/dispelling?
Maybe silence I is silent while walking, silence 2 while sprinting and swimming and silence 3 is while interacting.

The stealth system needs an update, and a stealth themed enchantment would be awesome. But, instead, make it have 5 levels, with each level reducing detection distance.

Possible name: Silent Step.
I think that adding tools and weapons of different woods would be a good detail

I agree, but doing this kinda rules out netherite helmets, so why not have a new turtle shell variation?  i propose a strider scale  helmet. Striders could have a chance to drop Strider Scales when you use a Warped Fungus on a Stick boost. craft 5 in the shape of a helmet, and boom, you have a Strider scale helmet. it would have the same durability and protection of a iron helmet, and give 10 seconds of fire resistance to the wearer.

i propose this to add some variation, instead of having an old item just being revamped, and it could give striders another use, as they can only be ridden at the moment.

WolFrost07 I love your idea of using strider scales - at the time I originally posted this striders weren't a thing yet! If we combined the ideas, maybe you could craft a Strider Shell by crafting the 5 strider scales and 1 turtle shell together? This would keep your idea of giving the striders another use whilst keeping my idea of upgrading the turtle helmet. Thank you for sharing your idea!

Mario Guy3 

no problem! using the turtle shell and the strider scales would help balance it for sure. I'm glad i could help with the discussion!
Good idea. Could even make wither bastions out of the new blocks.
Good idea. Could even make wither bastions out of the new blocks.
Me encanta esa idea, ese terror√≠fico bloque lleno de almas es una buena idea
So basically, Frost Walker, but with lava. Yes, please
I love this idea but make sure to say that the magma disappear much like frost walker enchantment
Also the magma would soon turn into basalt and back in to lava.
Awesome! I like that idea. Maybe a block like basalt to be generated when somebody walks with the Enchantment?
YES! This needs to be a thing or the ability to paint the bricks white or any other color. It'd add so much creativity to the game play
This would be so good! Then you can little pet fishes!
Who likes this idea?
They should also grow in very specific biomes, encouraging exploration
Maybe you should have marigolds too.craft them with slime balls to make a burn ointment
Thats a very good idea i will make a post for that
399764414571 I am not trying to steal your idea but thank you for that suggestion if it gets popular then it might be added.
399764414571 Sorry but the marigold idea was not accepted by minecraft so thank you for the suggestion and if you have any more ideas just say.
Not bad.
limit not should be so high. there is also lots of things to breathe under water. but 3 block lenght is sounds good
Enderman already drop Ender Pearls
I mean enderman already drop ender pearls, I think it would be better if there were Ender Crystals

I like that idea! Moreover, there could be even more ores we could find in the End such as: Amethyst or Onyx... Plus, it would give another reason for players to go to the End: which is to get better, improve their stuff... since the Ender is the last dimension the player has to go to!
I think for a challenge when they mine the ore. an endermite has a chance to spawn
ya endermen can be a pain to deal with
And Treasure too

I think Metal Detectors in Minecraft is definitely a good idea, but I think Mojang should allow the detector to only be able to dectect 10 or 20 blocks deep, so the players will still have to mine a little.
I think it need to be crafted with compass, magnet thing (I don't remember its name) and music block (because of beeps)
you have to be able to improve it, start with stone, then iron, gold, diamond.

This would make mining SO much easier!

What about a new ore to?

Yes and a display case or pedestal please to display special items.

You can get a similar effect now that item frames can be placed horizontally. But maybe the item should sit above the frame so it can be seen from the side as well as above.
Books especially so u can actually take te off and read them
Yes, single flowers by themselves are a bit lacking. Connected flower pots is a good idea. I think placing flowers like Sea pickles (up to 4 in a block) would be nice as well.
